dataset.image¶

ImagesBatch¶

class ImagesBatch(index, preloaded=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: dataset.image.batch_image.BasicImagesBatch

Batch class for 2D images

images are stored as numpy arrays (N, H, W) or (N, H, W, C)

apply_transform(ix, dst, src, func, *args, **kwargs)¶

Apply a function to each item in the batch

Parameters:
  • dst (str or array) –

    the destination to put the result in, can be:

    • str - a component name, e.g. ‘images’ or ‘masks’
    • array-like - a numpy-array, list, etc
  • src (str or array) –

    the source to get data from, can be:

    • str - a component name, e.g. ‘images’ or ‘masks’
    • array-like - a numpy-array, list, etc
  • func (callable) – a function to apply to each item from the source

Notes

apply_transform does the following (but in parallel):

for item in range(len(batch)):
    self.dst[item] = func(self.src[item], *args, **kwargs)
apply_transform_all(dst, src, func, *args, **kwargs)¶

Apply a function the whole batch at once

Parameters:
  • dst (str or array) –

    the destination to put the result in, can be:

    • str - a component name, e.g. ‘images’ or ‘masks’
    • array-like - a numpy-array, list, etc
  • src (str or array) –

    the source to get data from, can be:

    • str - a component name, e.g. ‘images’ or ‘masks’
    • array-like - a numpy-array, list, etc
  • func (callable) – a function to apply to each item from the source

Notes

apply_transform_all does the following:

self.dst = func(self.src, *args, **kwargs)
as_dataset(dataset=None)¶

Makes a new dataset from batch data

Parameters:dataset (could be a dataset or a Dataset class) –
Returns:
Return type:an instance of a class specified by dataset arg, preloaded with this batch data
assemble(all_res, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Assemble the batch after a parallel action

components = ('images', 'labels')¶
convert_to_pil(component='images')[source]¶

Convert batch data to PIL.Image format

crop(component='images', origin=None, shape=None)¶

Crop all images in the batch :param component: string - a component name which data should be cropped :param origin: can be one of:

  • tuple - a starting point in the form of (x, y)
  • CROP_00 - to crop from left top edge (0,0)
  • CROP_CENTER - to crop from center of each image
Parameters:shape – tuple - a crop size in the form of (width, height)
data¶

tuple or named components - batch data

do_nothing(*args, **kwargs)¶

An empty action (might be convenient in complicated pipelines)

dump(dst, fmt=None, components=None, *args, **kwargs)¶

Save data to a file or a memory object

flip(axis=None)¶

Flip images :param axis: ‘h’ for horizontal (left/right) flip

‘v’ for vertical (up/down) flip
Parameters:direction – ‘l’, ‘r’, ‘u’, ‘d’
fliplr(component='images')[source]¶

Flip image horizontaly (left / right)

flipud(component='images')[source]¶

Flip image verticaly (up / down)

from_batch(batch)¶

Create batch from another batch

from_data(index, data)¶

Create batch from a given dataset

get(item=None, component=None)¶

Return an item from the batch or the component

get_errors(all_res)¶

Return a list of errors from a parallel action

get_image_size(image)[source]¶

Return image size (width, height)

get_items(index, data=None)¶

Return one or several data items from a data source

get_model_by_name(model_name)¶

Return a model specification given its name

indices¶

numpy array - an array with the indices

items¶

list - batch items

load(src, fmt=None, components=None, *args, **kwargs)¶

Load data

make_filename()¶

Generate unique filename for the batch

make_item_class()¶

Create a class to handle data components

merge(batches, batch_size=None)¶

Merge several batches to form a new batch of a given size

Parameters:
  • batches (tuple of batches) –
  • batch_size (int or None) – if None, just merge all batches into one batch (the rest will be None), if int, then make one batch of batch_size and a batch with the rest of data.
Returns:

batch, rest
Return type:

tuple of two batches
merge_component(component=None, data=None)¶

Merge the same component data from several batches

noop()¶

Do nothing

put_into_data(data, components=None)¶

Load data into _data property

random_crop(component='images', shape=None)¶

Crop all images to a given shape and a random origin :param component: string - a component name which data should be cropped :param shape: tuple - a crop size in the form of (width, height)

Origin will be chosen at random to fit the required shape

random_rotate(ix, component='images', p=1.0, angle=None, **kwargs)¶

Rotate each image in the batch at a random angle :param component: string - a component name which data should be rotated :param p: float - a probability to apply rotate

(0. - don’t rotate, .5 - rotate half of images, 1 - rotate all images)
Parameters:angle – tuple - an angle range in the form of (min_angle, max_angle), in radians
random_scale(ix, component='images', p=1.0, factor=None, preserve_shape=True, crop=-1)¶

Scale the content of each image in the batch with a random scale factor :param component: string - a component name :param p: float - a probability to apply scale

(0. - don’t scale, .5 - scale half of images, 1 - scale all images)
Parameters:factor – tuple - min and max scale; the scale factor for each image will be sampled from the uniform distribution
resize(ix, component='images', shape=(64, 64))¶

Resize all images in the batch to the given shape :param component: string - a component name which data should be cropped :param shape: tuple - a crop size in the form of (width, height)

rotate(ix, component='images', angle=0, preserve_shape=True, **kwargs)¶

Rotate all images in the batch at the given angle :param component: string - a component name which data should be rotated :param angle: float - the rotation angle in degrees. :param preserve_shape: bool - whether to keep shape after rotating

(always True for images as arrays, can be False for PIL.Images)
run_once(*args, **kwargs)¶

Init function for no parallelism Useful for async action-methods (will wait till the method finishes)

save(*args, **kwargs)¶

Save batch data to a file (an alias for dump method)

apply_transform(ix, dst, src, func, *args, **kwargs)¶

Apply a function to each item in the batch

Parameters:
  • dst (str or array) –

    the destination to put the result in, can be:

    • str - a component name, e.g. ‘images’ or ‘masks’
    • array-like - a numpy-array, list, etc
  • src (str or array) –

    the source to get data from, can be:

    • str - a component name, e.g. ‘images’ or ‘masks’
    • array-like - a numpy-array, list, etc
  • func (callable) – a function to apply to each item from the source

Notes

apply_transform does the following (but in parallel):

for item in range(len(batch)):
    self.dst[item] = func(self.src[item], *args, **kwargs)
apply_transform_all(dst, src, func, *args, **kwargs)¶

Apply a function the whole batch at once

    the destination to put the result in, can be:

    • str - a component name, e.g. ‘images’ or ‘masks’
    • array-like - a numpy-array, list, etc
  • src (str or array) –

    the source to get data from, can be:

    • array-like - a numpy-array, list, etc
  • func (callable) – a function to apply to each item from the source

apply_transform_all does the following:

self.dst = func(self.src, *args, **kwargs)

crop(component='images', origin=None, shape=None)¶

Crop all images in the batch :param component: string - a component name which data should be cropped :param origin: can be one of:

  • tuple - a starting point in the form of (x, y)
  • CROP_00 - to crop from left top edge (0,0)
  • CROP_CENTER - to crop from center of each image
Parameters:shape – tuple - a crop size in the form of (width, height)

random_rotate(ix, component='images', p=1.0, angle=None, **kwargs)¶

Rotate each image in the batch at a random angle :param component: string - a component name which data should be rotated :param p: float - a probability to apply rotate

(0. - don’t rotate, .5 - rotate half of images, 1 - rotate all images)
Parameters:angle – tuple - an angle range in the form of (min_angle, max_angle), in radians
random_scale(ix, component='images', p=1.0, factor=None, preserve_shape=True, crop=-1)¶

Scale the content of each image in the batch with a random scale factor :param component: string - a component name :param p: float - a probability to apply scale

(0. - don’t scale, .5 - scale half of images, 1 - scale all images)
Parameters:factor – tuple - min and max scale; the scale factor for each image will be sampled from the uniform distribution

Rotate all images in the batch at the given angle :param component: string - a component name which data should be rotated :param angle: float - the rotation angle in degrees. :param preserve_shape: bool - whether to keep shape after rotating

(always True for images as arrays, can be False for PIL.Images)
